ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend this class to PhD students interested in intellectual or cultural history, or Europeanists who want to demystify intellectual history. We read books published recently, which helped us get a sense of the field today. This is a great course to help you think about writing, especially as a few of the books were first books / dissertations.

Would definitely recommend: good bibliography, great, intimate discussion. However, those who are looking for a more authoritarian approach and/or don't have a background in the field might find it difficult.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course has certainly helped me think about writing history, and about possible dissertation topics. We also discussed the business of academic publishing occasionally, something few instructors do.
Since I would like to pursue intellectualhistory further, I found the seminar to be personally extremely helpful for my academic development.
